conclusion: To determine how the shadows A, B, and C will change when the light source moves to the right above the objects, we need to understand the relationship between the light source, the objects, and the shadows they cast.
Shadow A is cast by the birdcage. The light source is currently positioned to the left of the birdcage, creating a shadow that extends to the right.
Shadow B is cast by the broken glass. The light source is currently positioned to the right of the broken glass, creating a shadow that extends to the left.
Shadow C is cast by the chicken leg. The light source is currently positioned to the left of the chicken leg, creating a shadow that extends to the right.
If the light source moves to the right, it will change its position relative to the objects. This will affect the direction and length of the shadows.

conclusion: The shadow of the birdcage will become shorter because the angle of the light with respect to the birdcage will change, making the shadow more direct.

conclusion: The shadow of the broken glass will become longer because the angle of the light with respect to the broken glass will change, making the shadow more spread out.

conclusion: The shadow of the chicken leg will become shorter because the angle of the light with respect to the chicken leg will change, making the shadow more direct.
